p: These data illustrate that during the immune reconstitution period 12–24 weeks after MA alloSCT, in the absence of acute GVHD, the observed increase in HLA class II-expressing cells in the dermis was caused by dermal macrophages with a non-professional APC phenotype. In contrast, in biopsies taken at the time of acute GVHD, inflammatory dermal DCs with professional APC phenotype were present.
